column4: ive made some critical errors to my sysv-rc-conf bootup. can someone give me some tips as to how to safely reinstall breezy. this is important as im dual bootin with win2000 and i definitely dont want to lose that partition
DO NOT DELETE LINUX WITH OUT REINSTALLING IT
no, do reinstall over it
but in windows do not just delete the windows partition
I have made that mistake more than once
ubuntu is the ext3 file system
ntfs is windows
if you are unsure, don't start deleting things, come in here and we will help you out
other than that, if you did it once you should do it again
oh.. still know the friend?
mm have 2 computers then? I can walk you through it, to much spam for this channel I think though
(slap) no!
ubuntu has a graphical installer?
select partition as ext3
choices?
manually edit
don't go back, whats it say under IDE master
second, this tutorial I have doesn't have that screen
no, I was hoping pictures
ok there should be a format option
does it say Yes, reformat this drive or something like that?
where it says format the existing partition
